summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from October to November 2021 between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding the scheduling of meetings and the identification of a trial witness from JPMorgan in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It reveals coordination between the legal teams and the involvement of a financial institution.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale representing or involved in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, coordinating scheduling and witness matters with the prosecution.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York involved in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, corresponding about scheduling and witness identification.

persons.name: Pat McHugh
persons.context: Individual referenced as part of a legal team with whom a call was to be scheduled; likely a colleague of Allison Stoddart.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the subject of the legal correspondence.

connections.description: Defense attorney and prosecutor corresponding to coordinate scheduling and discuss trial witness matters in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Stoddart references setting up a call with 'your team and Pat McHugh', indicating they are part of the same legal team or working group.
Sahni is an Assistant U.S. Attorney prosecuting the case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Stoddart is an attorney from WilmerHale involved in the Maxwell case, likely part of the defense team.

events.title: Scheduling Follow-up
events.description: Email follow-up regarding scheduling a meeting between legal teams, mentioning jury selection makes scheduling difficult.

events.title: Request for Trial Subpoena to JPMorgan
events.description: Defense attorney Allison Stoddart requests a trial appearance subpoena for a witness from JPMorgan.

events.title: Prosecution Sends Draft Exhibits
events.description: Prosecutor Anjan Sahni sends draft exhibits to facilitate conversation about identifying a witness from JPMorgan for trial.

locations: 7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich Street, New York, NY 10007
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The correspondence is between defense attorney Allison Stoddart of WilmerHale and prosecutor Anjan Sahni of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The defense is coordinating with the prosecution to identify and subpoena a trial witness from JPMorgan Chase Bank.
Jury selection in the Ghislaine Maxwell case was scheduled and impacting attorney availability in November 2021.
The prosecution provided draft exhibits to the defense to facilitate discussions about the JPMorgan witness.
The emails show ongoing legal procedural coordination in the lead-up to the Maxwell trial.
